clusters.title: One man dead after double shooting outside Sydney pub
clusters.neutral_headline: One Man Killed in Sydney Pub Shooting

items.title: One man dead after double shooting outside Sydney pub
items.standfirst: One man has been left dead and another injured after a shooting outside a hotel in Sydney's inner west.
items.content: One man has been left dead and another is in a critical condition after a shooting outside a pub in Sydney's inner west.Police were called to the Harold Park Hotel on Ross Street in Forest Lodge following reports of a public place shooting at about 6.40pm.Officers arrived to find two men shot multiple times by people who had left the scene in a car before police arrived.READ MORE: Businesses devastated after suspected firebombing in BrisbaneBoth men suffered multiple gunshot wounds each with NSW Ambulance paramedics treating them at the scene, however one man could not be saved.The other, who had wounds to the neck, chest and abdomen, was taken to Royal Prince Alfred Hospital in a serious condition. Witnesses reported hearing between six and 12 gunshots with multiple bullet casings found by police at the scene.One local told the Sydney Morning Herald (SMH) she saw one of the men shot about six times."He had been shot multiple times, at least six times," she said."But he was still conscious, and they put him in the ambulance so hopefully he makes a full recovery.""It just doesn't feel like something that happens in Sydney very often, but when it does happen it feels pretty scary."Among patrons in the busy pub were at least one doctor and nurse who rushed to offer first aid before multiple ambulance and police cars swarmed the scene. The pub's manager told the SMH the men were part of a group who had just left the hotel when the incident occurred, as they walked up Wigram Road.A third person was also assaulted during the incident according to the publication. A crime scene's been set up as police investigate the incident and Wigram Road remains closed.Anyone with information is being urged to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or https://nsw.crimestoppers.com.auDOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

clusters.title: Lucky escape as light plane crash lands on Sydney golf course
clusters.neutral_headline: Light Plane Crash Lands on Sydney Golf Course

items.title: Lucky escape as light plane crash lands on Sydney golf course
items.standfirst: Two people have had an incredible escape after their light plane crashed into a golf course, walking away with just minor injuries.
items.content: Two people have had an incredible escape after their light plane crashed into a golf course, walking away with just minor injuries. The plane was on a training flight when it ran into engine trouble over Sydney's northern beaches.The single engine Piper Cherokee crash landed on Mona Vale Golf Course around 2.20pm today.READ MORE: 'Never seen anything like it': Dad, grandparents hurt with machete in home invasion It was a shock for golfers on a busy afternoon on the course."So I turned around and we all had a look and it was coming straight over our heads," one golfer told 9News."And Nick who was playing with us, his dad's in aviation, so he said run. "So we just ran towards the trees and we just watched the plane come down and you could see the wheels."The pilot and his student, both in their 50s walked away largely unharmed.Witnesses say they got out as golfers ran to help.READ MORE: 'It is time': Trump hands Putin letter written by wife Melania Chris Peck from NSW Ambulance said they only suffered a few cuts."The pilot and the trainee pilot had minor abrasions were coherent and [had a full] recollection of events."The men had flown from Camden skirting around Sydney's west before heading north. They lost power over Palm Beach and were told to head to Long Reef but couldn't make it.The Piper Cherokee sustained serious damage and the reason for the crash is now one for air safety investigators.The light plane will remain on the course overnight, with insurers to organise it's removal from tomorrow.However, this could take a few days due to the hilly terrain around the site and fact that the ground's currently too wet for heavy machinery.This means part of the golf course will remain closed for a few days. DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

clusters.neutral_headline: Aussie Doctor's Friend Jailed for Running Strip Club

items.title: Rapist trusted by Aussie doctor to run US strip club jailed for 145 years
items.standfirst: Julian de Looze, a clinical director at Australia's biggest hospital, bought a strip club in Portland at the suggestion of a friend. He did not know that friend was a serial rapist who used the venue to prey on women.
items.content: Julian de Looze, a clinical director at Australia's biggest hospital, bought a strip club in Portland at the suggestion of a friend. He did not know that friend was a serial rapist who used the venue to prey on women.

clusters.ai_summary:
• Julian de Looze bought a strip club in Portland.
• He was unaware his friend was a serial rapist.
• The friend used the venue to prey on women.
• De Looze is a clinical director at a major Australian hospital.
• The rapist was sentenced to 145 years in jail.
